TopicTitle: How to bind the x52 pro to KSP

Articles.Content:
I got a Saitek X52 Pro in September and I'm looking for ways to bind the movements on the stick to KSP for spaceplanes. I tried just moving the stick in the change keybind button but that didn't work
Is there any mod / trick I don't know about that would be needed to do this

It's not clear to me what you're asking. In the settings screens there are a set of bindings you can apply to the stick's X, Y, and rotation axes (if it's a twist). Is that not how you were trying to do it?

I would go into KSP settings, then input, then would select pitch down and would do that on the stick
And it just doesn't acknowledge it
Are you referring to the x52 software?
